object.property: Select a configuration for all clicks.
Type a name for a new configuration (then click Add) or select another configuration.
Saves the currently specified configuration to the name shown.
Deletes the currently selected configuration and switches to the preceding configuration.
Select to have Click_Config use the configuration to which the document's source language is assigned.
Use the Define section below to edit these values.
Use the Define section below to edit these values.
Use the Define section below to edit these values.
Use the Define section below to edit these values.
Use the Define section below to edit these values.
Click_Config will select the first match for the regex that includes the clicked location.
The text selection to make for the given mouse click.
Use the Define section below to edit these values.
IGNORECASE Perform case-insensitive matching; expressions like [A-Z] will match lowercase letters, too.

MULTILINE Without this flag, only the current line is searched. When specified, the pattern character '^' matches at the beginning of the string and at the beginning of each line (immediately following each newline); and the pattern character '$' matches at the end of the string and at the end of each line (immediately preceding each newline). By default, '^' matches only at the beginning of the string, and '$' only at the end of the string and immediately before the newline (if any) at the end of the string.
DOTALL Make the '.' special character match any character at all, including a newline; without this flag, '.' will match anything except a newline.

VERBOSE This flag allows you to write regular expressions that look nicer. Whitespace within the pattern is ignored, except when in a character class or preceded by an unescaped backslash, and, when a line contains a '#' neither in a character class or preceded by an unescaped backslash, all characters from the leftmost such '#' through the end of the line are ignored.
These flags affect how the regular expression is evaluated.
Use the Define section below to edit these values.

Enter (or edit) a regular expression here that describes the kind of text item you want to select.
Drag and drop languages to assign them to a configuration.
Open a file browser to the location of the Click_Config configuration file.
Import all configurations and selection definitions from another configuration file.
Discard any changes made and close this window.
Apply changes made but keep this window open.
Apply any changes made and close this window.
